issue.title: Feature: Use blockquote instead of div or make confugurable

labels.name: awaiting reply
labels.description: Waiting for a response from the author to proceed

issue.body:
### Goal or desired outcome

This plugin currently does not really produce semantic markup it seems. The desirable outcome would be to either output a top-level blockquote instead of a div or, possibly even better, have the top-level tag as a configurable setting.

### Feature description

Either swap the outer `div` tag for a `blockquote` tag or allow the outer tag to be configurable.

### Additional context

_No response_

comment.body:
Thanks for sharing your thoughts. I totally agree that your approach is a great way to balance semantics with practical functionality. 

The plugin will keep using `details` as a no-JS option for those who prefer it, and Iâ€™m planning to add aria attributes to improve accessibility.

Great to discuss these ideas with you!

issue.body:
### Goal or desired outcome

This plugin currently does not really produce semantic markup it seems. The desirable outcome would be to either output a top-level blockquote instead of a div or, possibly even better, have the top-level tag as a configurable setting.

### Feature description

### Additional context

comment.body:
Thanks for sharing your thoughts! I totally agree on balancing semantics with practical functionality. The plugin will keep using details and summary as a no-JS option for those who prefer it. Additionally, I'm planning to add aria attributes to improve accessibility.

Great to discuss these ideas with you!

issue.title: Feature: Use blockquote instead of div or make confugurable

labels.description: May be realized or fixed in next version

issue.body:
### Goal or desired outcome

This plugin currently does not really produce semantic markup it seems. The desirable outcome would be to either output a top-level blockquote instead of a div or, possibly even better, have the top-level tag as a configurable setting.

### Feature description

### Additional context

_No response_

comment.body:
@TotallyInformation Thanks for the feature requestâ€”it highlighted the semantic markup issue for me. I've now added an `htmlTagNames` option in https://github.com/lin-stephanie/rehype-callouts/commit/0c789f4ec500a1199c0ca8099831be8f60ebed70 to allow more flexible HTML tag naming. 

For collapsible callouts, though, the `details` and `summary` tags are functionally required, but I think using `collapsibleContentTagName` could achieve a similar semantic effect. What do you think of this approach?

commits.message: feat: added `htmlTagNames` option to configure HTML tag names in the callout structure for greater semantic flexibility (ref #8)
feat: apply `dir="auto"` to callout container elements for automatic text direction
